com.yahoo.gondola

Interface Stoppable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Channel, Clock, Network, Storage
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Cluster, CoreMember, FakeStorage, Gondola, H2dbStorage, MemoryChannel, MemoryNetwork, MySqlStorage, NastyChannel, NastyNetwork, NastyStorage, SocketChannel, SocketNetwork, SystemClock

    public interface Stoppable
    This interface is used by objects that create helper threads within their implementation. The user of Stoppable components can start and stop these internal worker threads by called start() and stop() respectively. The methods start() and stop() are not thread-safe and should only be called in exactly the correct sequence - start(), then stop(), then start(), etc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void start()
      Start all threads needed by the object.
      void stop()
      Stops all threads in the object.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
    throws Exception
        Start all threads needed by the object.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops all threads in the object. After this call, it should be possible to call start() to restart the threads. Can be called after a failed start() to try and clean up any
